channel.title: Two Coders? HELP
channel.description: [size=14pt]I am coding my server, and I need my co owner to help do some things while im doing something else, is there any way for us both to code and update it without something like dropbox or anything? I know it can be done I know some servers where 4 different people can code, compile and restart the server...[/size]

item.title: Two Coders? HELP
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I would not advise getting a vps until you are ready to make it live.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Coders? HELP

item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“miller4, post:3, topic:493653”]I have found the solution. I have a VPS but I cba with setting it up before the server is finished, I just needed something quick and I found it. Thanks for the reply (;[/quote]Share your quick find with us.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Coders? HELP
item.dc:creator: @Haydnz1234 Haydnz1234
item.description:
@Haydnz1234 wrote:

miller4:

[size=14pt]I am coding my server, and I need my co owner to help do some things while im doing something else, is there any way for us both to code and update it without something like dropbox or anything? I know it can be done I know some servers where 4 different people can code, compile and restart the server…[/size]

4 Different people? It could be that they have a VPS, A VPS lets several people go onto it and runs litterally 99.9% of the time so it could be a VPS their using, but for you, if you don’t have a VPS, you can always upload the source to dropbox and then him re-upload it yes. That would work but I advise you take out the cache and save it somewhere before uploading to dropbox (if your working on revisions that have the cache in the server files) otherwise it would be a big upload!

Read full topic
